person.persName: John Watts (Secretary for N.M. Governor/Comm Deeds)

body.p: Native of Indiana. Son of attorney John Sebree Watts who served as a congressional delegate of the New Mexico Territory in the 1860s. John Watts visited New Mexico in 1858-1859 with his father to improve his health and see his older brother J. Howe Watts. The family briefly went back to their home in Bloomington, Indiana in late 1859 or early 1860. John Watts returned to the New Mexico Territory in the early 1860s while his father served as a congressional delegate. By 1864, he worked as the private secretary of Governor Henry Connelly. Served as a commissioner of deeds for the Commonwealth of Kentucky in New Mexico. He went on to become a prominent banker in Santa Fe.
